newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Seoul stocks seen gaining on blue chips strength.
newsitem.headline: Seoul stocks seen gaining on blue chips strength.

text.p: Seoul stocks are expected to remain firm throughout Wednesday on continued buying interest in blue chips ahead of an increase in the foreign stock ownership ceiling, brokers said.
The limit will be raised from 20 to 23 percent from May 2.
"Core blue chips will continue to be highlighted," said Park Ki-pyong of Hanyang Securities. "The index is likely to test the 710 level soon."
The composite stock index closed on Tuesday 0.07 points firmer at 649.97.
Brokers said the market would face a brief consolidation following recent steep rises.

Financial reform proposals by a presidential panel would have little impact on foreign selling of financial shares, they said. Foreign investors seemed to switch to blue chips from financial shares before the ceiling expansion, brokers said.
The Presidential Commission for Financial Reform would recommend the reform package next week, including a proposal to allow big conglomerates to participate in bank management.
